entry.title: Today in DeFi - Archway L1 Live, stUSDT Live, crvUSD, Borrowing on Curve, and more...
entry.summary: Archway L1 Live Archway, a Cosmos-based L1 with incentives for devs, has launched its mainnet. Archway plans to distribute a portion of the token emission directly to dApps. It will allocate 25% to devs and the remaining 75% to validators. stUSDT Live

entry.title: Today In DeFi - SMG Halts Ethereum (for 12s), Polygon 2.0 Architecture, Stable farms and more
entry.summary: SMG Halts Ethereum Special Mechanism Group "halted ethereum transactions” for 12 seconds, by exploiting PBS (proposer builder separation). SMG achieved this by proposing an empty block and outbidding others for block inclusion. In their thread, SMG argues for

entry.title: Today in DeFi - Maple Launches Lending Desk, Aptos NFT Aggregator, Incentivized LPing and more
entry.summary: Maple Launches Lending Desk Undercollateralized CeDeFi lending platform Maple Finance is launching a lending desk. “We witnessed first-hand the shortcomings of CeFi last year and will raise the bar for lending desks through a commitment to compliance, transparency, and quality,” said Sidney Powell, CEO and co-founder of Maple Finance.

entry.title: Today in DeFi - CCTP Live on Arbitrum, Sudoswap Wrapped Pools, Good Farms and more...
entry.summary: CCTP on Arbitrum

entry.title: Today in DeFi - Introducing ZK Stack, WBTC & ETH Markets for crvUSD, Earn Fixed Rate on DAI, and more...
entry.summary: Matter Labs Introduces ZK Stack Matter Labs released the ZK Stack for building ‘Hyperchains’. Devs who build Hyperchains can choose to create Layer 2s that run parallel to zkSync Era, or Layer 3s that run on top of it. WBTC, ETH Markets for crvUSD Live

entry.title: Last Week in DeFi - Maker Savings DAI, Polygon POS to ZK L2, Regulation Updates, and More...
entry.summary: Recap: Week of June 19th

entry.title: Today in DeFi - Velodrome V2 Live, Prime Trust Halted Withdrawals, PENDLE Yield Boost, and more...
entry.summary: Velodrome V2 Live Velodrome launched V2 with a new VELO token. V2 enables new features including concentrated liquidity support, dynamic fees, dynamic emission rate, velodrome relay, enhanced UX, etc. V1 users will have about a week to migrate to V2 before the emission begins on V2 on June 29th.

entry.title: Today in DeFi - MakerDAO Savings DAI, Camelot AMM v3 Live, Stake to Yield, and more...
entry.summary: MakerDAO Savings DAI MakerDAO announces Savings DAI (sDAI), a tokenized version of DSR-enabled DAI. sDAI is now available on Spark Protocol by depositing DAI in exchange for sDAI. Camelot AMM v3 Live Arbitrum-based DEX Camelot launches its AMM V3, backed by Algebra’s concentrated liquidity engine and integrated with Paraswap.

entry.title: Today in DeFi - Magpie Bridge Live, Dopex Option Scalps V2, Automated LPing, and more...
entry.summary: Magpie Bridge Live Magpie, a non-custodial cross-chain swap, goes live and supports transfers between seven chains. Magpie uses Wormhole's Guardian Network to communicate asset swap signals between blockchains, in order to offer secure, efficient bridging.

entry.title: Today in DeFi - UK Approves Crypto Laws, opBNB Testnet Live, Incentives and Snapshots for Trading, and more...
entry.summary: UK Approves Crypto Laws UK parliamentarians approved Financial Services and Markets Bill (FSMB) on Monday. FSMB is a new bill that could recognize crypto as a regulated activity and stablecoins as a means of payment under existing laws. The bill still needs further approval to be put into force.

entry.summary: Recap: Week of June 12th

entry.title: Today in DeFi - DLN Exchange Live, Celsius to Sell Altcoins, Delta-Neutral Vaults, and more...
entry.summary: DLN Exchange Live DLN, a native cross-chain swap by deBridge, is live. DLN exchanges assets directly without asset wrapping or liquidity pool and offers fast transfers with incentives and without MEV, AMM fees, or slippage. Celsius to Sell Altcoins Celcius

entry.title: Today in DeFi - EigenLayer Mainnet Live, Hashflow Exploit, Borrowing on LSTs, and more...
entry.summary: EigenLayer Mainnet Live ETH re-staking protocol EigenLayer launches stage-1 mainnet on Ethereum. Initially, the protocol supports staking for Lido’s stETH, RocketPool’s rETH, and Coinbase’s cbETH with a 3200 cap for each, for which all pools are now at capacity.

entry.title: Today in DeFi - Aevo Public Launch, Uniswap V4, Future Yield Trading, and more...
entry.summary: Aevo Public Launch Options AMM Aevo is now open to the public. Anyone can now trade ETH/BTC options & perps, as well as do OTC trading. Uniswap V4 Coming Uniswap announced V4 with released the early implementation of the code. The new version will enable Hooks, the singleton architecture, Flash Accounting, native ETH for pool operations, and governance updates.

entry.title: Today in DeFi - Polygon 2.0, Keep3r Exploit, Stable Yield Pools, and more...
entry.summary: Polygon 2.0 Polygon Labs introduces Polygon 2.0, a set of upgrades to offer scalability and unified liquidity via ZK tech. The team will share more details about the future of Polygon PoS, token evolution, and decentralized governance in the coming weeks.

entry.title: Today in DeFi - SudoSwap V2, Delorean GNS Yield Market, Staking Incentives, and more...
entry.summary: SudoSwap V2 Live P2P NFT marketplace SudoSwap launches V2. The upgrade brings new features such as on-chain royalties, custom creator settings, EIP-1155 support, etc. Delorean GNS Yield Market Live Arbitrum-based future yield DEX Delorean launches the

entry.title: Today in DeFi - Arbitrum Stopped for an Hour, Hubble Exchange Testnet, Auto-compounding crvUSD Yield, and more...
entry.summary: Arbitrum Stopped for an hour Arbitrum stopped processing transactions for about an hour due to a bug found in the batch poster. The bug hit and paused the Sequencer to finalize transaction ordering on-chain. Arbitrum team has fixed the bug and resumed network operation.

entry.title: Today in DeFi - Optimism Bedrock Live, SEC Sues Coinbase, Upgraded Options Trading, and more...
entry.summary: Optimsim Bedrock Live Optimism has upgraded to Bedrock. The upgrade enables lower fees, shorter deposit times, and improved modularity & performance. SEC Sues Coinabse The SEC sued Coinbase after Binance for operating as an unregistered exchange and broker, and that 13 assets listed on Coinbase were considered crypto asset securities.
